intro: Delissea lumahaiensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows along coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, saline conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Delissea lumahaiensis is a rare and endemic species, highlighting the unique botanical diversity of Hawaiian flora.
